headline: AMD vs. INTC vs. TSM: Will These Chipmakers Rally as High as NVDA?
summary: Advanced Micro Devices (AMD), Intel (INTC), and Taiwan Semiconductor Manufacturing (TSM) are major players in the chipmaking and artificial intelligence (AI) segment but have seen varying degrees of success over the past two years — none have experienced Nvidia’s (NVDA) groundbreaking success. Personally, I’m bearish on Intel and TSMC, but I’m bullish on AMD, expecting it to experience continued market share gains and share price appreciation over the medium term. headline: As AMD Struggles, Bearish Option Trade Could Return 11% In About 5 Weeks
summary: AMD dropped 3% Wednesday and is below declining 21-, 50- and 200-day moving averages. I’m willing to bet that upside will be limited from here.

raw.headline: As AMD Struggles, Bearish Option Trade Could Return 11% In About 5 Weeks
